t: Investing in Amazon Stock (AMZN)
s: Amazon is grouped with consumer discretionary stocks for investing purposes, though it is also included in many mutual funds and exchange-traded funds (ETFs) focused on the technology sector in recognition of Amazon Web Services’ (AWS) status as a leading cloud computing provider.

t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 4 hours ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.

t: Amazon Stock Price Today | NASDAQ: AMZN Live - Investing.com
s: Amazon's most recent stock split occurred on June 3, 2022. This was a 20-for-1 stock split. Previously, Amazon had three splits in the late 1990s: a 2-for-1 split in June 1998, a 3-for-1 split in January 1999, and a 2-for-1 split in September 1999. What Stock Exchange Does Amazon Trade On?
